    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oai</catalog>

          <identifier>
            <catalog>lre</catalog>
            <entry>cahi1:data_94223</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Sounds travel through solids and liquids</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Tonspielraum durch Körper und Flüssigkeiten</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Voyage de bruits par des solides et des liquides</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Curso dos sons através dos sólidos e dos 
líquidos</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Corsa dei suoni attraverso i solidi ed i liquidi</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Ταξίδι ήχων μέσω των στερεών και των υγρών</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Recorrido de los sonidos a través de los 
sólidos y de los líquidos</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">This illustration shows that sounds travel through liquids and solids. Whales send sound through water (top), and sound vibrations from an earthquake travel through the Earth (bottom).</string>
          </description>
          <language>x-none</language>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Earth</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">earthquake</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Liquid</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">ocean</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Solid</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">sound</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">vibrations</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">water</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">whales</string>
          </keyword>
          <structure>
            <source>structureValues</source>
            <value>atomic</value>
          </structure>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Diese Abbildung stellt dar, daß die Spielraum 
durch Flüssigkeiten und Körper klingt. Wale senden Ton durch 
Wasser (Oberseite), und stichhaltige Erschütterungen von einem 
Erdbeben reisen durch die Masse (Unterseite).</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Cette illustration montre que cela retentit le 
voyage par des liquides et des solides. Les baleines envoient le
bruit par l'eau (dessus), et les vibrations saines d'un tremblement de
terre voyagent par la terre (bas).</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Esta ilustração mostra que aquela soa o curso 
através dos líquidos e dos sólidos. As baleias emitem o som 
através da água (alto), e as vibrações sadias de um terremoto 
viajam através da terra (fundo).</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Questa illustrazione mostra che quella suona la 
corsa attraverso i liquidi ed i solidi. Le balene trasmettono il
suono attraverso acqua (parte superiore) e le vibrazioni sonore da un 
terremoto attraversano through la terra (parte inferiore).</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Αυτή η απεικόνιση δείχνει ότι οι ήχοι ταξιδεύουν 
μέσω των υγρών και των στερεών. Οι φάλαινες στέλνουν τον 
ήχο μέσω του ύδατος (κορυφή), και οι υγιείς δονήσεις από έναν 
σεισμό ταξιδεύουν μέσω της γης (κατώτατο σημείο).</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Esta ilustración muestra que ésa suena 
recorrido a través de líquidos y de sólidos. Las ballenas 
envían el sonido a través del agua (tapa), y las vibraciones sanas 
de un terremoto viajan a través de la tierra (fondo).</string>
          </description>
